text: Millie Dunn Veasey (January 31, 1918 – March 9, 2018) was an American veteran. She was born in Raleigh, North Carolina. She served from 1942-45 in the Women’s Army Corps (WAC) and the Women’s Auxiliary Army Corps (WAAC). She was active in the civil rights movement with the Raleigh-Wake Chapter of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People (NAACP), where she became president in 1965. Veasey died on March 9, 2018 in Raleigh at the age of 100. ==References== Category:1918 births Category:2018 deaths Category:American centenarians Category:National Association for the Advancement of Colored People Category:Military people from North Carolina Category:People from Raleigh, North Carolina
title: Millie Dunn Veasey
